findings.title: Incorrect comments
findings.description: The comment indicates incorrect information about variable or function usage.

findings.title: Unclear events
findings.description: The `RoleGranted` and `RoleRevoked` events are emitted when roles are granted or revoked, but they do not indicate which vault was modified and what role was granted or revoked.

findings.title: Unreachable or unnecessary code
findings.description: The codebase contains unreachable or unnecessary code.

findings.title: Curve3CoinPoolAdapter’s _addLiquidity reverts due to incorrect amounts deposited
findings.description: The `_addLiquidity` function overwrites the number of tokens to send for the first asset, causing far fewer tokens to be deposited than expected, thus causing the transaction to revert due to the slippage check.

findings.title: Reallocation process reverts when a ghost strategy is present
findings.description: The reallocate function reverts and makes it impossible to reallocate the smart vault when a ghost strategy is present.

findings.title: Broken test cases that hide security issues
findings.description: Removing a line from a test case did not fail the test case, providing a false sense of confidence in the code's correctness and potentially hiding security issues.

findings.title: Reward emission can be extended for a removed reward token
findings.description: After removing a reward token from a smart vault, the value of `tokenAdded` in the `rewardConfiguration[smartVault][token]` configuration is left as nonzero, which allows the smart vault owner to extend the reward emission for the removed token.

findings.title: A reward token cannot be added once it is removed from a smart vault
findings.description: Smart vault owners cannot add reward tokens again after they have been removed once from the smart vault, making owners incapable of providing incentives to users.

findings.title: Missing whenNotPaused modifier
findings.description: The `whenNotPaused` modifier was missing, allowing users to claim rewards even when the system is paused.

findings.title: Users who deposit and then withdraw before doHardWork lose their tokens
findings.description: Depositing users who withdraw before calling doHardWork will result in token loss.

findings.title: Lack of events emitted for state-changing functions
findings.description: State change correctly and sufficiently after an interaction with the protocol without emitting events.

findings.title: Removal of a strategy could result in loss of funds
findings.description: A Spool admin can remove a strategy from the system, which will be replaced by a ghost strategy in all smart vaults that use it; however, if a strategy is removed when the system is in specific states, funds to be deposited or withdrawn in the next “do hard work” cycle will be lost.

findings.title: ExponentialAllocationProvider reverts on strategies without risk scores
findings.description: The ExponentialAllocationProvider contract's calculateAllocation function can revert due to a division-by-zero error when a single strategy has an APY value of 0.

findings.title: Removing a strategy makes the smart vault unusable
findings.description: Removing a strategy from a smart vault causes every subsequent deposit transaction to revert, making the smart vault unusable.

findings.title: Issues with the management of access control roles in deployment script
findings.description: Missing role assignments and inconsistent access control checks were identified in the system, affecting the deployment script.

findings.title: Risk of DoS due to unbounded loops
findings.description: Unbounded loops can cause a denial-of-service (DoS) attack, making the smart contract vulnerable.

findings.title: Unsafe casts throughout the codebase
findings.description: The codebase contains unsafe casts that could cause mathematical errors if they are reachable in certain states.
